critique: This document is an order to allow the House of Representatives Committee on Public Works to inspect tax returns from 1960-1974. It is related to an investigation of the administration of programs affecting the Committee on Public Works. It does not seem to have any ideological tilt. It does not relate to immigration. It could be argued that it expands executive power by allowing access to tax returns, but it is also in line with existing rules and regulations. It does not relate to federalism. It could be argued that it infringes on civil liberties by allowing access to tax returns, but it is also in line with existing rules and regulations. It does not relate to economic regulation. It does not relate to social inclusion.
